name: The Fool
prompts: {player}, do your silliest walk across the room.
{player}, speak in a dramatic movie trailer voice until your next turn.
{player}, swap seats with {someone} without saying a word.
{player}, for the next round you can only answer with “yes” or “no”.
{player}, pick {someone} to mirror your actions for one round.
{player}, you must introduce yourself like a superhero origin story.
{player}, let {someone} change your name for the next 3 rounds.
{player}, you must narrate everything you do out loud until your next turn.
Reveal your best “sexy pose” for 5 seconds.
Let Player {someone} choose a song and dance close for 20 seconds.
Last person to touch the floor takes 2 sips.
Everyone makes a funny face — the worst one drinks.

miniGame.title: Fool’s Spotlight
miniGame.description: {player}, you have 30 seconds to make everyone laugh. If no one laughs, you do another dare.

name: Death
prompts: {player}, your old dare is dead. Draw a new card and do BOTH.
{player}, end one habit for the rest of the game. If you break it, you take a dare.
{player}, swap your drink or snack with {someone}. No take-backs.
{player}, you must speak in whispers until your next turn.
{player}, your phone is now off-limits for 2 rounds. Break it → dare.
{player}, choose one rule of the game to kill. Everyone must obey the change.
{player}, pretend you don’t know {someone} for one full round.
{player}, sacrifice your next turn and give a dare to {someone} instead.
Try to wink at someone without anyone noticing — if caught, take another dare.
Everyone points at who they think is most likely to survive a zombie apocalypse — most votes drinks.
Last person to stand up and sit down drinks.
Everyone makes a dramatic death pose — worst one drinks.

miniGame.title: Who Faces the End?
miniGame.description: Everyone points at the one who deserves the harshest dare.

name: The Lovers
prompts: {player}, pick {someone}. You two must answer one deep question about each other.
{player}, compliment {someone} with three oddly specific nice things.
{player}, pick a duo. The rest of the group asks them one spicy question each.
{player}, call {someone} your favourite person for the next 2 rounds.
{player}, swap seats with {someone} and share one embarrassing story.
{player}, pick two players who must do a synced pose together.
{player}, choose {someone}. The group decides a cute nickname for them.
{player}, pick a pair who must act like a couple until one of them draws a major card.
What's the biggest turn-on personality trait for you?
Everyone pairs up and shares a fun fact about their partner — worst fact drinks.

miniGame.title: Perfect Match?
miniGame.description: {player} and {someone} are now a duo. Group decides who is the more chaotic half.

name: The Tower
prompts: {player}, your world crumbles. Let {someone} rewrite your next dare.
{player}, stand up and freeze in the most dramatic pose for 10 seconds.
{player}, let the group choose one word you can’t say for 3 rounds.
{player}, your seating is destroyed. Move to a completely new spot.
{player}, pick {someone}. You both must answer the next dare together.
{player}, act like everything is in slow motion until your next turn.
{player}, tell a story about your most chaotic day ever.
{player}, for one round you must overreact to everything anyone says.
Stare-down battle with Player {someone}. First to look away does a dare.
Group votes: most energetic person takes a sip.
Everyone makes a tower with their hands — last to finish drinks.
On the count of 3, everyone points at who they think is most likely to 'fall' and take a dare.

miniGame.title: Who Falls from the Tower?
miniGame.description: On 3, everyone points at the person who should get the toughest dare.

name: Wheel of Fortune
prompts: {player}, your luck decides. Flip a coin: heads = dare, tails = truth.
{player}, choose {someone}. If they guess your favourite snack, they’re safe. If not, they take a dare.
{player}, roll an imaginary dice: 1–3 you drink / 4–6 you dare {someone}.
{player}, pick {someone}. Rock, paper, scissors: loser does a dare.
{player}, let {someone} decide if you get an easy or hard dare.
{player}, if your birth month is odd, answer a truth; if even, do a dare.
{player}, ask the group: “Am I lucky or cursed?” Majority vote decides who gets the dare.
{player}, if you’ve laughed in the last 30 seconds, you do a dare with {someone}.
What’s your current relationship status and one thing you enjoy about it?
Rock-paper-scissors with Player {someone}: loser sips.

miniGame.title: Spin of Fate
miniGame.description: {player}, you have 15 seconds to convince everyone you deserve an easy dare. If they are not convinced, you get a hard one.

name: Judgement
prompts: {player}, confess something you did that nobody in this room knows.
{player}, the group judges you. Let them decide if you get truth or dare.
{player}, pick {someone} and tell them one honest opinion you’ve never said out loud.
{player}, rate everyone’s vibe from 1–10. No explanations.
{player}, the group gives you a new rule you must follow for 3 rounds.
{player}, admit one thing you were wrong about recently.
{player}, pick {someone}. You both must say one nice thing and one funny roast about each other.
{player}, let the group decide a title for your autobiography.
Share your guilty crush (fictional or celebrity allowed).
Pick someone who laughs the loudest — they drink!

miniGame.title: Judgement Day
miniGame.description: Who has been the most chaotic tonight? They receive the next dare.

name: The Hermit
prompts: {player}, share a thought you usually keep to yourself.
{player}, close your eyes and describe the room from memory.
{player}, pick {someone} and ask them a deep question.
{player}, say one thing you’ve learned about yourself in the last year.
{player}, for one round, you can only speak when spoken to.
{player}, choose someone you secretly admire and give them a genuine compliment.
{player}, if you had to disappear for a week, who would you tell first?
{player}, share one habit you want to change and let the group suggest how.
Look someone in the eyes for 10 seconds. No laughing. Loser gets dared.
Everyone shares a secret talent — worst one drinks.

miniGame.title: Quiet Truth
miniGame.description: {player}, you have 30 seconds to answer anything the group asks—no jokes, only honest answers.

name: The Devil
prompts: {player}, admit a guilty pleasure you usually hide.
{player}, pick {someone}. You both must share one mildly unhinged thought.
{player}, tempt the group: offer an easy dare for yourself or a hard dare for {someone}.
{player}, for one round you must encourage every bad idea jokingly.
{player}, share the wildest thing you have considered doing but never did.
{player}, let {someone} read one random message notification on your phone (or take a dare instead).
{player}, choose two players to form a ‘chaos duo’. They must do the next dare together.
{player}, describe your villain arc in 3 sentences.
Attempt a pickup line on Player {someone}. They rate it out of 10.
Laugh without showing your teeth — fail = drink.
Imitate a famous villain — worst impression drinks.

miniGame.title: Deal with the Devil
miniGame.description: {player} chooses {someone}. Group decides who deserves the harsher dare.
